column4: Today I joined volunteers from @AgeWellVT to deliver meals to seniors in Franklin County. The work that these amazing volunteers do providing meals and companionship for seniors is more important than ever during this pandemic. Thank you! https://t.co/HcWsOE0QS0

I trust Dr. Fauci and other experts. That’s why I introduced legislation in May that would prevent heads of the National Institute of Health from being removed for political reasons.  https://t.co/7f43axbCfd
This is well deserved recognition for our nurses here in Vermont! Thank you to nurses everywhere for all that you do, especially during this pandemic. https://t.co/4xwScQk6xJ

These are challenging times. The pandemic has created a range of opportunities for fraudsters and scammers, and it’s important to remain vigilant. Click below for more information on how you can protect yourself: https://t.co/BNI4QeaQAV
No surprise here - the president is more interested in confirming an extreme SCOTUS nominee than helping the millions of Americans struggling because of this brutal virus. https://t.co/DZ86jcrKbF

Thank you to @Masks4Missions & @gracepotter! Today is #VTMaskDay & as we head into the fall & winter, it’s imperative that we listen to the health experts & do our part. We are all in this together. Wear a mask & help save lives! https://t.co/MKrBZgkmvW
They provide needed relief for local restaurants & live venues. The pain of the pandemic is still being felt across Vermont, and Leader McConnell needs to get off the sidelines and act. #vtpoli

Last night, with my support, the House passed an updated Heroes Act to deliver much needed Covid aid to communities across the country. In addition to the critical help for individuals and families, the bill includes my RESTAURANTS Act and SOS Act. #vtpoli
I wish @realDonaldTrump and @FLOTUS, and all Americans sick with Covid, a full and speedy recovery.

Today, I’m back in DC to pass an updated Heroes Act. It includes badly need Covid relief, including more than $15 billion in emergency broadband funding for families & students to make sure that they can connect for school, work, & doctors appointments. https://t.co/auCim2O4VJ

Proud to have voted last night for this deal to keep the government open, stop USCIS furloughs, and boost #3SquaresVT. We have more work to do in December and still badly need a Covid relief package, but this deal avoids a shutdown now. #vtpoli https://t.co/9TTTkrmfRk
RT @RepDianaDeGette: Reports that the White House nixed this plan to mail 5 face masks to every American because they “didn’t want to cause…

Now is not a time for half measures. According to a recent study, 1 in 9 Vermonters were facing food insecurity before the pandemic. Now, that number has skyrocketed to 1 in 4. The Senate vote on a ‘skinny’ package does nothing for them. It is cruel and wrong.

.@realdonaldtrump knew how bad COVID was and lied about it. Now the Senate GOP refuses to pass aid to help Americans suffering from those lies. This is a historic failure of leadership. https://t.co/t32AVoAGll

Live music is more than a show. It brings people together and helps our local economies. Venues across the world have had to close their doors as a result of the coronavirus pandemic and many are facing permanent closure. https://t.co/KgqDFpJnqk

An accurate census count by the end of September is impossible due to the pandemic and political interference from the Trump administration. The census deadline must be extended, but in the meantime, fill out your Census now at https://t.co/LhlE37G0mv

With millions expected to vote by mail this November, and many Americans getting their medicine or unemployment check by mail during this pandemic, this bill will make sure that the Postal Service has the funds and the support it needs to deliver the mail on time.
Even Moderna admits that the coronavirus vaccine they’re working on belongs to the American taxpayers who paid for it. https://t.co/T6Q86v7h6k

70,000 people have died and millions have lost their jobs since the House passed the Heroes Act, which would extend UI benefits and establish the tracing, testing and quarantine strategy that we need. Last night, the Senate went home without acting.
RT @GovPhilScott: Vermont is so fortunate to have Dr. Mark Levine as ⁦@healthvermont⁩ commissioner. He and his entire team have been nothin…

Proud to introduce the #SaveOurStages Act in the House today. We need to help venues like @HigherGround survive this pandemic so artists like @gracepotter have places to play once we can all enjoy live music again. More info here: https://t.co/yXwXYaRWIy
Thank you, @GovPhilScott for mandating mask wearing indoors and where social distancing isn’t possible. We are all in this together. Wear a mask and help save lives. #MaskOnVT https://t.co/Hd9GcFExAI

Transparency & oversight are crucial to good government. @RepKatiePorter & I sent a letter to @SecAzar asking how more than $6.6b in taxpayer $ going to private pharma companies through ‘Operation Warp Speed’ will support development of an affordable vaccine for COVID-19. https://t.co/W8edz4qZLC

It is dangerous and ignorant for the president to try and block money for coronavirus testing and contact tracing. The health and safety of Americans should never be a partisan issue. https://t.co/iAFAmAJDDz

Trying to discredit disease experts is not a strategy. Our strategy needs to be informed by science, coordinated by experts and clearly communicated. A nationally coordinated testing, tracing and quarantine strategy is key. https://t.co/lAMXwGBRKT
A record number of COVID infections today, but the only action the president takes is to pardon his corrupt friend... https://t.co/xLmNboJfeQ
Mr. President, it’s time to start leading at home instead of pointing fingers abroad. Hundreds of Americans are dying every day while you ignore the reality of this pandemic. https://t.co/V4mYa53sL7

Only the federal government has the resources to craft a nationwide testing, tracing and quarantine strategy to stop the #COVID19 pandemic. Implementing these measures is the ONLY WAY to safely reopen our economy. Ignorance cannot stop this pandemic. https://t.co/pbSy7Mm6Vq
Wishing you and yours a happy Fourth of July! I’m looking forward to when we can celebrate again in person. In the meantime, stay safe and healthy and wear your mask!

Big Pharma never misses an opportunity to rip us off, even in the midst of a pandemic that’s killed more than 120k Americans. #COVID19 treatments MUST be affordable, esp those that taxpayer $$ paid for. Proud to co-sponsor a bill to require fair pricing for #COVID19 treatments. https://t.co/H6SwIjUpwC
Over 100,000 lives have been lost in this country because of COVID-19. Today we honor them. Please join me for a moment of silence at noon. #Lament100K

RT @RepMcGovern: Withdrawing from the World Health Organization during a global pandemic is just plain stupid.

Leaving the @WHO because of…

Thank you to Cpl. Ally Jacob and Sgt. Schuyler Himberg for your great care when I got tested in St. Johnsbury! I was in D.C. a week ago to vote on the latest #COVID aid package, and although I feel great and have no symptoms I decided to get tested. https://t.co/czGmMYyeWh

During this #EMSWeek, join me in thanking our brave EMS personnel for all that they do for us around the clock, especially during this devastating pandemic. Congress needs to do more to make sure they have the PPE they need and the hazard pay they have earned. #vtpoli

Tomorrow is Florence Nightingale’s birthday and the end of National Nurses Week. Join me in thanking our nurses for all that they do for us, especially during this terrible pandemic. https://t.co/nPbT4QE4ck

Nearly 20% of children are not getting enough to eat during this pandemic. That is unacceptable. The Trump administration should be working with Congress to expand food security programs rather than turning its back on those in need. We need to act NOW! https://t.co/yaIu4wZrp6
Headed back to Vermont after a day in DC. Pleased to have passed more #CoronavirusRelief but more work to do. Be safe and good night. https://t.co/HBRV5qt1wS

I’m back in DC today to vote for a package to help our small businesses & hospitals in VT. This bill will restart the PPP program, provide funding for our hospitals on the front lines of this #coronavirus pandemic & increase the availability of testing. #vtpoli https://t.co/mXD62hTW6b

Today is #EarthDay, when we are reminded of the importance of making smart choices for a greener, cleaner & healthier planet. I hope you will join me in celebrating & remembering that all of us can play a role in protecting our planet. #vtpoli

Wow! What a great PSA from A2VT and @rhinofoodsinc! It’s a catchy and creative way to encourage folks to #stopthespread. #coronavirus

https://t.co/eE2VgaiM7b

We should begin carefully planning how and when to safely reopen the country. We need a smart, science-based approach led by public health experts. That’s why I will soon introduce the Reopen America Act with @RepRaskin, @RepShalala, @RepJeffries, and @RepAnnaEshoo. #vtpoli https://t.co/5ZylZyKSS1

It was great to catch up with @RepAOC yesterday. We discussed how we’re coping with the coronavirus and the incredible impact @SenSanders has had on this country. Remember, social distancing does not mean emotional distancing! We are all in this together! #FlattenTheCurve https://t.co/3QQGWVLXEB

On my website https://t.co/rTg6WpSMSS you can find the most up-to-date information on the coronavirus pandemic. My office is available as a resource for individuals, families, and businesses coping with this pandemic. #vtpoli

Thanks to the over 8,500 Vermonters who joined me tonight for all or part of my statewide telephone town hall meeting on the coronavirus pandemic. I am grateful for the thoughtful questions and feedback I received. https://t.co/FaMErMLh1w

Today at 4:50pm, I’ll be hosting a live statewide telephone town hall on the assistance available for people impacted by the coronavirus pandemic with @SenSanders and @SenatorLeahy. I hope you’ll join in. To participate, dial 866-641-6916 anytime between 4:50pm and 5:50pm.
RT @GovPhilScott: Grocery & food supply workers are critical to our COVID-19 response. To all of you working long & stressful hours, thank…

I have been hearing from Vermonters around the world that they are not getting the support they need to come home. This is unacceptable. Today @SenSanders and I called on the State Department to bring our friends and neighbors home now! #coronavirus #vtpoli https://t.co/q744gUFX4F

We appreciate and won’t forget the work of our grocery store workers, pharmacy clerks, letter carriers, couriers, cleaning crews, and others who are now on the front lines helping us get through this challenging time. Thank you! We are all in this together. #coronavirus #vtpoli https://t.co/1bZ6zCPKNl

With schools closed, Vermont teachers and students are dealing with a “homework gap”. The #coronavirus pandemic is exposing a bleak daily reality for many Vermonters – the #digitaldivide in rural areas prevents kids from learning online at home. #vtpoli
To every front line provider—first responder, nurse, PA, doctor, assistant, janitor—fighting this #coronavirus outbreak who can’t work from home: We thank you and won’t forget you. #vtpoli
Two weeks of paid sick leave and up to three months of paid family and medical leave so that workers can stay home if they are sick or need to be quarantined.
Testing, testing, testing. The bill makes sure that coronavirus testing is FREE for all Americans.

Last night the House acted decisively to protect public health and the financial security of families impacted by the #coronavirus outbreak. The Senate and President must act now to put these protections into law. #vtpoli  

Specifically, the bill includes:

There is no excuse for keeping health experts in the dark about #coronavirus. President Trump needs to allow the experts to do their jobs without his political interference. #vtpoli https://t.co/z0GqnEcvhZ

We’ve adopted a few tips from the @CDCgov in my office to help keep staff & visitors healthy. We found their recommendations on how to reduce the potential spread of #coronavirus helpful. Vermonters with questions about the disease can visit my website at https://t.co/rTg6WpBc1k. https://t.co/xRDH6XyIUX

President Trump wants to raid funds from a program that helps vulnerable families heat their homes to make up for his slow and inadequate #coronavirus response. We can fight this public health threat without shutting off people’s heat. #LIHEAP #vtpoli https://t.co/ATWHo9gNJY

On the 47th anniversary of #RoevWade, women’s rights are under attack across the country. I am fighting to block outrageous attacks on women’s health and proud that Vermont is a leader in protecting women’s rights. #vtpoli
Got healthcare? Starting today, visit https://t.co/32iyeGBcFz to #GetCovered and pick a healthcare plan that’s right for you and your family. #vtpoli

What’s more “sickening” @senatemajldr is that you and @realDonaldTrump hold the keys to common sense gun reforms. The nation is reeling. Lead on this or get out of the way! #vtpoli https://t.co/q46ioouR4n

The Trump Administration has embraced a lawsuit being argued right now in the 5th Circuit that would repeal health care coverage for Americans with preexisting conditions. They have no plan to replace it. #ProtectOurCare https://t.co/czdBToMmsc

Those working on the front lines of the opioid epidemic in Vermont must have the resources they need to succeed. Today I met with folks in Morrisville who are working day in and day out to save lives. Their passion and unwavering commitment is inspiring. #vtpoli https://t.co/ZQSk71FY5b
Americans are dying because they can’t afford their insulin. I’m working hard to crack down on patent abuse and rein in drug prices. #ForThePeople #HealthCareWeekend https://t.co/eLsU0nl1kh
Proud to stand in solidarity with @ppnnehealth to stop the assault on women’s reproductive health care. #vtpoli https://t.co/CuhQsK5jkX
Great to see so many gathered in Montpelier tonight to oppose nationwide efforts to turn back the clock on women’s reproductive health. #StopTheBans #vtpoli https://t.co/NhfeK9op6W

Pleased the House passed my amendment to stop the Trump administration from ending the #ACA automatic re-enrollment program, ensuring that 2 million Americans will keep their health insurance. Looking forward to voting for the final bill tonight. #ProtectOurCare

Today I introduced the #LIFTAmerica Act with all of my @EnergyCommerce Dem colleagues. This comprehensive infrastructure bill fights #ClimateChange, expands rural broadband and protects public health and the environment. #InfrastructureWeek
RT @DartmouthHitch: Health Policy Grand Rounds today at DHMC with VT's @PeterWelch. #VTpoli #NHpolitics #HealthPolicy https://t.co/ByTDdh6k…

Yesterday I joined @GovPhilScott in breaking ground for the Thomas W. Huebner Medical Office Building at @RutlandRegional .  Tom was an extraordinary leader for the hospital, the Rutland community and our state. Congrats, Tom!
https://t.co/eiRog5vn7t #vtpoli
Sending warm wishes to Vermonters celebrating Passover this weekend.  Wishing you and your family health and happiness.
Today in @EnergyCommerce we will advance several bills that make long overdue progress for the American people on healthcare, prescription drugs, #ClimateChange and #NetNeutrality. #vtpoli

Proof positive that @RealDonaldTrump is siding with corporate polluters over public health and safety. The new Congress will step up to safeguard the air we breathe and the water we drink.

This misguided decision threatens to rip health care away from millions of hardworking families. The courts will overturn, and Congress must get to work securing quality, affordable health care for all Americans. #vtpoli https://t.co/8HFicUHXcM
